Q: How do I find where my git repository is located? A:

when the following command is used

git rev-parse --show-toplevel

it shows the absolute path of the top-level directory of the current git repository.
using this you can confirm from which directory you initiated the git repository

Note:- above command should be run anywhere inside the repository

if you are not aware whether you are inside repo or not then you can try

find . -type d -name '.git'

Q: Fresh install Windows miniforge prompt does not start in base environment, throws errors with mamba commands, and cannot activate environments at all A:

After freshly installed Miniforge, you need to initialize the shell(conda/mamba) first before being able to use it.

If I run the command that it provided mamba shell init --shell cmd.exe --root-prefix=~/.local/share/mamba and then restart the prompt, it now has (C:\Users\Name\miniforge3) as a modifier

Since you mentioned you are on Windows, you shouldn't use the above command as it is for linux. Instead you should use this

mamba shell init --shell cmd.exe --root-prefix="C:\Users\YOURUSERNAME\miniforge3"

This will initialize shell for your cmd, if you wanna use it in powershell, use --shell powershell instead.

NOTE: If you initialized your shell with mamba, you must use mamba to manage your environment, conda activate won't work in this case. But you can still use conda to install packages and more.
